Posts.Title: Pre-op nerves

Posts.Content: I had a left breast mastectomy with an immediate implant reconstruction on 23rd May. 2 1/2 weeks on I am still sore but getting better every day. The 2 worst bits for me were firstly the drain bag which I had in for 10 days, it was uncomfortable and restricting but the hospital provided me with a bag, which I attached a long strap to and wore it over my shoulder which made it a bit easier (it hurts like mad if you get up and forget about it) it's now a week since the drain came out and I'm moving about much more easily. The second thing was awful constipation because of the painkillers, I have never experienced anything like it - I contacted my GP who gave me some Laxido which helped get me moving again, it took a few days but I'm back to normal now (I also stopped taking the cocodomol and just stuck to paracetamol, preferring to be a little less comfortable in the breast area rather than the bottom area) I'd recommend having a supply of Laxido or something similar and taking it from the start if you can. Apart from that front fastening, loose clothes are a godsend, I got a couple of soft front fastening bras and a few shirts which I'm still wearing till I get movement back in my arm properly. Doing the excercises every day is important too, not too much but as much as you can manage, that too is getting easier every day. I'm starting to feel like I can do a bit more now, I've rested every day and my husband has sorted meals out and kept the kitchen clean and tidy, I'll get to the rest of the house at some point when I feel able, probably next week, till then it can wait
